basics.name: Ivan Lomeli
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: An aspiring software engineer graduating from Swarthmore College Spring 2019. A computer science major seeking full-time employmeent in the greater Southern California area.

courses: Computer Vision, Database Management Systems*, Animations*, Machine Learning Fundamentals, Adaptive Robotics*, Computer Networks*, Software Engineering*, Data Structures and Algorithms*, Computer Systems*, Linear Algebra , Discrete Mathematics, Engineering Methodology*, Single Variable Calculus, Mechanics*, Electrical Circuit Analysis* (* denotes lab component)

work.summary: Engaged in theory and practice of digital scholarship. Gained hands-on experience with web development and design, digital media, text analysis and data visualization. Obtained Doaim Validateed-type SSL certificate for McCabe Library infrastructure. Automated the process of certificate renewal.
Worked with lather and mill machinery producing parts for different clients (i.e: Space X). Learned how to use precision measuring tools to analyze the produced parts for quality.

Interned under the Central Recordâ€™s department of a top international law firm that specializes in the areas of Intellectual Property Law, Employment law, Real State, and many others. Managed case files through record-keeping software used to track down files from all global locations. Awarded the top-tier monetary scholarship of excellence award.

volunteer.summary: Organize weekly practices and a yearly season.
Designed and delivered workshops that developed students' capabilities to carry out effective social media strategies of engagement, awareness raising, marketing, advertising, & storytelling.

volunteer.position: Chair of Student Life, Chair of Student Outreach
volunteer.summary: Evaluate campus concerns and work towards long-term policy solutions
Developed organization and time management skills by balancing academics and varsity athletics. Commit over 25 hours each week. Acquired experience performing in high pressure situations.

awards.title: Aurora Camacho de Schmidt Scholar Activism Recognition Award
awards.summary: Outstanding scholarly work that interrogates social justice, equity, and community principles espoused by the IC. Innovative research projects that advance learning, dialogue, and reflection. Engagement of praxis to connect theoretical frameworks and social justice practice.

awards.title: Philip H. Barley '66 Memorial Scholarship
awards.summary: The scholarship provides financial assistance for a junior or senior who has demonstrated outstanding leadership qualities at Swarthmore.

awards.title: Richard Rubin Scholar
awards.summary: The Richard Rubin Scholar Program awards eligible students of high academic performance mentorship and intern opportunities to advance their scholastic, inter-personal, social and professional success at Swarthmore College and beyond.
